definition: to flout the law
worker/workshop/(slang) troublesome/high-maintenance (person)
to do/to grow/to write or compose/to pretend/to regard as/to feel/writings or works
wicked/crafty/traitor/variant of 姦|奸[jian1]
to fornicate/to defile/adultery/rape
to violate/to offend/to assault/criminal/crime/to make a mistake/recurrence (of mistake or sth bad)
branch of study/administrative section/division/field/branch/stage directions/family (taxonomy)/rules/laws/to mete out (punishment)/to levy (taxes etc)/to fine sb/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: Or were you beheaded because you did evil to infringe upon the law?
sentences.chinese: 是作奸犯科，触犯了法律，因而被人砍头？

sentences.english: Few people know that he is actually a criminal.
sentences.chinese: 没人知道他其实是个作奸犯科的人。

sentences.english: It's haunted with Buddhist demons and devils. Their mission is the endless punishment of human sinners.
sentences.chinese: 这里有佛教的妖魔鬼怪，任务是惩罚作奸犯科之人。

sentences.english: The police tried to trace his lapse into petty crime.
sentences.chinese: 警察试图追踪他小打小闹作奸犯科的缘由。
